subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: legal issue?
author: Vicky Cox
full_text:
I left the page but removed the link from the page. I saw 2 pictures that
they got and I couldn't even begin to see what they say they saw. The group
has been around for about 5 years. It took them months to get together for
this investigation and not only did they have NO history on the place they
still couldn't tell me the name of it. BTW It's called the Monroe County
Michigan Museum Navarre Anderson Trading Post Complex
http://historicmonroe.org/muse um-navarre-anderson-traiding-p
ost-complex/country-store-site -structures.htm
It's the oldest wooden structure in Michigan and the rules state that you
may not stay there overnight but mention nothing about being there
overnight.
Here's the evidence:

http://paranormalarcheologysurveyteam.weebly.com/evps-1-10.html

On Thu, Aug 18, 2011 at 9:46 PM, Urkel23 <urkel23@aol.com> wrote:

> **
>
>
>
> Is your photos and audio so good that it's worth fighting over? Get your
> new group going and start posting new stuff from that. Forget about the
> other stuff for now, you still have it on your computer if you want to
> listen to it.
>
> Take it down and re-post it in 6 months when they forgotton about it.
>
> -Steve
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Vicky Cox <vickyw222@...> wrote:
> >
> > I have a legal question that I cannot seem to find an answer to. I
> recently
> > went on an investigation to a public place with a paranormal group. While
> > my experience is much less than theirs, I found them to be too
> disorganized.
> > Three people came from the group. One had no equipment and the second
> used
> > his cell phone. I never even saw a pencil. So, I started a small group,
> > specifically for amateur investigators staying in local public places so
> we
> > don't get in over our heads. We aren't trying to get any resident
> > investigations and are non competitive. On our site I put photos and evps
> I
> > had gotten while on the investigation and put at the bottom that some
> > evidence was obtained while on investigations with other groups. I didn't
> > use any of their names. As with any of my photos, I blocked out any
> faces,
> > and it was all on my equipment. I signed nothing and agreed to nothing.
> > Yesterday he sent me an email saying he wants it taken down. It's
> > technically and legally his ( technically and legally?). If I wanted to
> > start my own group all I had to do was ask. He has said that I invited a
> 16
> > year old to join the group (Definitely didn't). And that he thought I
> would
> > join their group.
> > -I don't believe he's right on the legal issue. Ethically, I would have
> > accredited the group if he was more diplomatic and maybe even taken it
> down.
> >
> > - wouldn't making false accusations make him guilty of liable?
> > - I don't need to ask him to do ****. I've met him twice.
> >
> > Does anybody know of any place where I can find something written on the
> law
> > about those photos and media being mine.
> >
> > --
> > Vicky
> >
>
> 
>



-- 
Vicky
